gurmukhi: ਹੁਤੇ ਦੲੀਤ ਜੇ ਲੋਕ ਮੱਧਯੋ ਹੰਕਾਰੀ || ਭੲੇ ੲੇਕਠੇ ਭ੍ਰਾਤਿ ਭਾਵੰ ਬਿਚਾਰੀ ||੨||
transliteration: Houte Daeet Je Lok Maddhyo Hankdaree|| Bhae Ekathe Bhraat(i) Bhaavan Bichdaree||2||
translation: Considering this gathering as some stratagem against them, the proud demons also gathered together.2.

gurmukhi: ਬਦਯੋ ਅਰਧ ਅਰਧੰ ਦੁਹੂ ਬਾਟਿ ਲੀਬੋ || ਸਭੋ ਬਾਤ ਮਾਨੀ ਯਹੈ ਕਾਮ ਕੀਬੋ ||
transliteration: Badyo Aradh Aradhan Duhoo Baat(i) Leebo|| Sabho Baat Maaniyahai Kaam Keebo||
translation: Now both the groups decided that whatever shall be attained, the same shall be distributed equally. All of them agreed on this proposal and the work was begun;

gurmukhi: ਕਰੋ ਮੱਥਨੀ ਕੂਟ ਮੰਦ੍ਰਾਚਲੇਯੰ || ਤਕਯੋ ਛੀਰ ਸਾਮੁੰਦ੍ਰ ਦੇਅੰ ਅਦੇਯੰ ||੩||
transliteration: Daro Mathhanikoot Mandraachleyan|| Takyo Chheer Saamounndra Dean Adeyan||3||
translation: Both the gods and demons settled the programme of churning the milk-ocean, making churning-stick of the Mandrachal mountain.3.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੀ ਮੱਥਕਾ ਬਾਸਕੰ ਸਿੰਧ ਮੱਧੰ || ਲਾਗ ਦੋੳੂ ਭੲੇ ਅੱਧ ਅੱਧੰ ||
transliteration: Karimatthakaa Baaskan Sindh Maddhan|| Mathai Laag Dooo Bhae Addh Addhan||
translation: The serpent Vasuki was made the rope of the churning-stick and dividing the participants equally, both the ends of the rope were held tighty.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰੰ ਦੈਤ ਲਾਗੇ ਗਹੀ ਪੂਛ ਦੇਵੰ || ਮਥਯੋ ਛੀਰ ਸਿੱਧੈ ਮਨੋ ਮਾਟਕੇਵੰ ||੪||
transliteration: Siran Dait Laage Gadipoochh Devan|| Mathyo Chheet Siddhai Mano Maatkevan||4||
translation: The demons caught hold of the side of the head and the gods the tail, they began to churn like the curd in a vessel.4.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਸੋ ਕੳੁਣ ਬੀਯੋ ਪਰੇ ਭਾਰੁ ਪੱਬੰ || ੳੁਠੇ ਕਾਂਪ ਬੀਰੰ ਦਿੱਤਯਾਦਿੱਤਯ ਸੱਬੰ ||
transliteration: Iso Kaoun Beeyo Dare Bhaar(u) Pabhan|| Outhe Kaanp Bderan Dittyaadittya Sabhan||
translation: Now they reflected on this idea as to who can be the mighty hero, who can endure the load of the mountain (because a base was required for the purpose)? Hearing this Ditya, Aditya etc., the heroes shuddered, faltering in absurd prattle.

gurmukhi: ਤਬੈ ਅਾਪ ਹੀ ਬਿਸਨ ਮੰਤ੍ਰੰ ਬਿਚਾਰਯੋ || ਤਰੇ ਪਰਬਤੰ ਕੱਛਪੰ ਰੂਪ ਧਾਰਯੋ ||੫||
transliteration: Tabai Aap Bisan Mantran Bichdaryo|| Dare Parbatan Kachchhpaan Roop Dhdaryo||5||
translation: Then observing this difficulty of both the gods and demons, Vishnu himself thought about it and transforming himself in the form of Kachh (tortoise), seated himself at the base of the mountain.5.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕ ਗ੍ਰੰਥੇ ਦੁਤੀਅਾ ਕਛ ਅੳੁਤਾਰ ਸੰਪੂਰਨਮ ਸਤ ||੨||
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Douteeaa Kachh Aoutaar Sanpooranam Sat||
translation: End of the description of the second Kachh (tortoise), incarnation in BACHITTAR NATAK.2.

gurmukhi: ਅਥ ਛੀਰ ਸਮੁੰਦ੍ਰ ਮਥਨ ਚੳੁਦਹ ਰਤਨ ਕਥਨੰ ||
transliteration: Ath Chheer Samounndraa Mathan Chaudah Ratan Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description of the Churing of the Milkocean and the Fourteen Jewels:
Let Shri Bhagauti Ji (The Primal Power) be helpful.
